get.summary: Adds a message to the chat log.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The chat message.

get.summary: Changes the password of an existing Subsonic user, using the following parameters. You can only change your own password unless you have admin privileges.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user which should change its password.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The new password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded.

get.summary: Creates or updates a bookmark (a position within a media file). Bookmarks are personal and not visible to other users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the media file to bookmark. If a bookmark already exists for this file it will be overwritten.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position (in milliseconds) within the media file.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: A user-defined comment.

get.summary: Creates (or updates) a playlist.

parameters.name: playlistId
parameters.description: The playlist ID. (if updating)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the playlist.

parameters.name: songId
parameters.description: ID of a song in the playlist. Use one songId parameter for each song in the playlist.

get.summary: Adds a new Podcast channel.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the Podcast to add.

get.summary: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the Subsonic server. The URL is short and suitable for posting on Facebook, Twitter etc.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Creates a new Subsonic user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the new user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded (see above).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the new user.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenicated in LDAP.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: playlistRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and delete playlists.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

get.summary: Deletes the bookmark for a given file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes an existing internet radio station.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes a saved playlist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes a Podcast channel.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes a Podcast episode.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes an existing share.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Deletes an existing Subsonic user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user to retrieve. You can only retrieve your own user unless you have admin privileges.

get.summary: Request the server to start downloading a given Podcast episode.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns details for an album, including a list of songs. This method organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns album notes, image URLs etc, using data from last.fm.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Similar to getAlbumInfo, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums. Similar to the album lists on the home page of the Subsonic web interface.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The list type. Must be one of the following: random, newest, frequent, recent, starred, alphabeticalByName or alphabeticalByArtist. Since 1.10.1 you can use byYear and byGenre to list albums in a given year range or genre.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of albums to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The list offset. Useful if you for example want to page through the list of newest albums.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: The name of the genre, e.g., "Rock".

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: The first year in the range. If fromYear > toYear a reverse chronological list is returned.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: The last year in the range.

get.summary: Similar to getAlbumList, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The list type. Must be one of the following: random, newest, frequent, recent, starred, alphabeticalByName or alphabeticalByArtist. Since 1.10.1 you can use byYear and byGenre to list albums in a given year range or genre.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of albums to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The list offset. Useful if you for example want to page through the list of newest albums.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: The name of the genre, e.g., "Rock".

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: The first year in the range. If fromYear > toYear a reverse chronological list is returned.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: The last year in the range.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders.

get.summary: Returns details for an artist, including a list of albums. This method organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns artist info with biography, image URLs and similar artists, using data from last.fm.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of similar artists to return.

parameters.name: includeNotPresent
parameters.description: Whether to return artists that are not present in the media library.

get.summary: Similar to getArtistInfo, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of similar artists to return.

parameters.name: includeNotPresent
parameters.description: Whether to return artists that are not present in the media library.

get.summary: Similar to getIndexes, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders

get.summary: Returns all bookmarks for this user. A bookmark is a position within a certain media file.
Returns the current visible (non-expired) chat messages.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only return messages newer than this time (in millis since Jan 1 1970).

get.summary: Returns all genres.
Returns an indexed structure of all artists.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders

parameters.name: ifModifiedSince
parameters.description: If specified, only return a result if the artist collection has changed since the given time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970).

get.summary: Returns all internet radio stations.
Adds a new internet radio station.

parameters.name: streamUrl
parameters.description: The stream URL for the station.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The user-defined name for the station.

parameters.name: homepageUrl
parameters.description: The home page URL for the station.

get.summary: Updates an existing internet radio station.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID for the station.

parameters.name: streamUrl
parameters.description: The stream URL for the station.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The user-defined name for the station.

parameters.name: homepageUrl
parameters.description: The home page URL for the station.

get.summary: Get details about the software license.
Searches for and returns lyrics for a given song.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: The artist name.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The song title.

get.summary: Returns a listing of all files in a music directory. Typically used to get list of albums for an artist, or list of songs for an album.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns all configured top-level music folders.
Returns the most recently published Podcast episodes.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of episodes to return.

get.summary: Returns what is currently being played by all users.
Returns a listing of files in a saved playlist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns all playlists a user is allowed to play.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: If specified, return playlists for this user rather than for the authenticated user. The authenticated user must have admin role if this parameter is used.

get.summary: Returns the state of the play queue for this user (as set by savePlayQueue). This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book).

Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes. This method can also be used to return details for only one channel - refer to the id parameter. A typical use case for this method would be to first retrieve all channels without episodes, and then retrieve all episodes for the single channel the user selects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: If specified, only return the Podcast channel with this ID.

parameters.name: includeEpisodes
parameters.description: Whether to include Podcast episodes in the returned result.

get.summary: Returns random songs matching the given criteria.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of songs to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return songs in the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: Only returns songs belonging to this genre.

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: Only return songs published after or in this year.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: Only return songs published before or in this year.

get.summary: Returns the current status for media library scanning.
Initiates a rescan of the media libraries.
Returns information about shared media this user is allowed to manage.
Returns a random collection of songs from the given artist and similar artists, using data from last.fm. Typically used for artist radio features.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of songs to return.

get.summary: Similar to getSimilarSongs, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of songs to return.

get.summary: Returns details for a song.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns songs in a given genre.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: The genre, as returned by getGenres.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of songs to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset. Useful if you want to page through the songs in a genre.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders

get.summary: Returns starred songs, albums and artists.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders

get.summary: Similar to getStarred, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders

get.summary: Returns top songs for the given artist, using data from last.fm.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: The artist name.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of songs to return.

get.summary: Get details about a given user, including which authorization roles and folder access it has. Can be used to enable/disable certain features in the client, such as jukebox control.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user to retrieve. You can only retrieve your own user unless you have admin privileges.

get.summary: Get details about all users, including which authorization roles and folder access they have.
Returns details for a video, including information about available audio tracks, subtitles (captions) and conversions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID

get.summary: Returns all video files.
Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the server's audio hardware. Note

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The operation to perform.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Used by skip and remove. Zero-based index of the song to skip to or remove.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used by skip. Start playing this many seconds into the track.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Used by add and set. ID of song to add to the jukebox playlist. Use multiple id parameters to add many songs in the same request. (set is similar to a clear followed by a add, but will not change the currently playing track.)

parameters.name: gain
parameters.description: Used by setGain to control the playback volume. A float value between 0.0 and 1.0.

get.summary: Used to test connectivity with the server.
Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes.

Saves the state of the play queue for this user. This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song in the play queue. Use one id parameter for each song in the play queue.

parameters.name: current
parameters.description: The ID of the current playing song.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position in milliseconds within the currently playing song.

get.summary: Registers the local playback of one or more media files. Typically used when playing media that is cached on the client.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to scrobble.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) at which the song was listened to.

parameters.name: submission
parameters.description: Whether this is a "submission" or a "now playing" notification.

get.summary: Returns a listing of files matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Searches all fields.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Artist to search for.

parameters.name: album
parameters.description: Album to search for.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Song title to search for.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Search result offset. Used for paging.

parameters.name: newerThan
parameters.description: Only return matches that are newer than this. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query.

parameters.name: artistCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

parameters.name: artistOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

parameters.name: albumCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

parameters.name: albumOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

parameters.name: songCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

parameters.name: songOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders.

get.summary: Similar to search2, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query.

parameters.name: artistCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of artists to return.

parameters.name: artistOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for artists. Used for paging.

parameters.name: albumCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of albums to return.

parameters.name: albumOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for albums. Used for paging.

parameters.name: songCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of songs to return.

parameters.name: songOffset
parameters.description: Search result offset for songs. Used for paging.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: Only return results from the music folder with the given ID. See getMusicFolders.

get.summary: Sets the rating for a music file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to rate.

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: The rating between 1 and 5 (inclusive), or 0 to remove the rating.

get.summary: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to star. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: albumId
parameters.description: The ID of an album to star. Use this rather than id if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: artistId
parameters.description: The ID of an artist to star. Use this rather than id if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Removes the star from a song, album or artist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the file (song) or folder (album/artist) to star. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: albumId
parameters.description: The ID of an album to star. Use this rather than id if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: artistId
parameters.description: The ID of an artist to star. Use this rather than id if the client accesses the media collection according to ID3 tags rather than file structure. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.

parameters.name: playlistId
parameters.description: The playlist ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the playlist.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The playlist comment.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: true if the playlist should be visible to all users, false otherwise.

parameters.name: songIdToAdd
parameters.description: Add this song with this ID to the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

parameters.name: songIndexToRemove
parameters.description: Remove the song at this position in the playlist. Multiple parameters allowed.

get.summary: Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Modifies an existing Subsonic user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the user, either in clear text of hex-encoded.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the user.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenicated in LDAP.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: playlistRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and delete playlists.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: The maximum bit rate (in Kbps) for the user. Audio streams of higher bit rates are automatically downsampled to this bit rate. Legal values: 0 (no limit), 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320.

get.summary: Returns the avatar (personal image) for a user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user to retrieve. You can only retrieve your own user unless you have admin privileges.

get.summary: Returns captions (subtitles) for a video. Use getVideoInfo to get a list of available captions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the video.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Preferred captions format ("srt" or "vtt").

get.summary: Returns a cover art image.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of a song, album or artist.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: If specified, scale image to this size.

get.summary: Creates an HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) playlist used for streaming video or audio. HLS is a streaming protocol implemented by Apple and works by breaking the overall stream into a sequence of small HTTP-based file downloads. It's supported by iOS and newer versions of Android. This method also supports adaptive bitrate streaming, see the bitRate parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the media file to stream.

parameters.name: bitRate
parameters.description:
If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If this parameter is specified more than once,
the server will create a variant playlist, suitable for adaptive bitrate streaming.
The playlist will support streaming at all the specified bitrates. The server will automatically choose video dimensions that are suitable for the given bitrates.
Since 1.9.0 you may explicitly request a certain width (480) and height (360) like so: bitRate=1000@480x360

parameters.name: audioTrack
parameters.description: The ID of the audio track to use. See getVideoInfo for how to get the list of available audio tracks for a video.

get.summary: Streams a given media file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

parameters.name: timeOffset
parameters.description: Only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the video. Typically used to implement video skipping.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance "640x480".

parameters.name: converted
parameters.description: Only applicable to video streaming. Subsonic can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to "true" will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

parameters.name: estimateContentLength
parameters.description: if set to "true", the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., "mp3" or "flv") in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value "raw" to disable transcoding.

get.summary: Downloads a given media file. Similar to stream, but this method returns the original media data without transcoding or downsampling.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to download. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

passwdAuth.name: p
passwdAuth.description: The password, either in clear text or hex-encoded with a "enc:" prefix.

tokenAuth.name: t
tokenAuth.description: The authentication token computed as md5(password + salt).

saltAuth.name: s
saltAuth.description: A random string ("salt") used as input for computing the password hash. See below for details.

versionAuth.name: v
versionAuth.description: The protocol version implemented by the client

clientAuth.name: c
clientAuth.description: A unique string identifying the client application.

formatAuth.name: f
formatAuth.description: Request data to be returned in this format. Supported values are "xml", "json" and "jsonp". If using jsonp, specify name of javascript callback function using a callback parameter.
